11110101D-d-11-01-11-WSOR.Narrative:
TRAIN WAS SHOVING TIMETABLE EASTBOUND WITH 13 LOADED CARS INTO TRACK 2 OF INDUSTRY, WITH CONDUCTOR RIDING THE LEADING END OF THE SHOVING MOVEMENT AS REQUIRED.  DURING THIS SHOVING MOVEMENT, AN EMPLOYEE OF THE INDUSTRY USED A REMOTE CONTROL TRACK MOBILE TO MOVE A CUT OF 9 CARS ON AN ADJACENT TRACK, COLLIDING INTO THE SIDE OF THE EQUIPMENT BEING MOVED BY THE RAILROAD.

NO EQUIPMENT BEING MOVED BYTHE RAILROAD DERAILED.  
ONE TRACK MOBILE AND TWO CARS BEING MOVED BY THE INDUSTRY DERAILED.  

EQUIPMENT DAMAGE DETAILS:  
AS SHOWN IN BOX 36, DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT BEING MOVED BY THE RAILROAD = $27,750.00.  
ADDITIONALLY, DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT BEING MOVED BY THE INDUSTRY = $135,031.  

TRACK ISNOT OWNED BY THE RAILROAD AND IS MAINTAINED BY INDUSTRY.

1111RS019-d-11-23-11-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing spikes or other rail fasteners)
1111RS019-d-11-23-11-UP.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing spikes or other rail fasteners)
1111RS019-d-11-23-11-UP.Narrative: THE LRS46-23 WAS SHOVING INTO WEST END OF THE BEST RUNAROUND.  CREW HAD A 10-CAR HANDLE AND 15 SPOTCARS FOR SIMPLOT AS THEY SHOVED INTO TRACK 120.  THE BRAKEMAN RIDING THE POINT NOTICED DIRT RISING IN THE AIR SEVERAL CARS BEHIND AND STOPPED THE MOVE.  UPON INSPECTION, THE L3 WHEEL ON THE SECOND CARFROM THE POINT DERAILED FIRST.  POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE AT THE VERY WEST END OF THE SIDING AT THE TOP OF A GRADE.  AS THE CARS WERE SHOVED INTO THE SIDING, THE OUTSIDE RAIL ROLLED ALLOWING THE OPPOSITE WHEEL TO DROP INSIDE TO THE GROUND.  TRAILING WHEELS CONTINUED TO DROP INSIDE DERAILING 6 CARS.  TRAIN SPEED DID NOT EXCEED 5 MPH.  THE BRAKEMAN STATED NO HAND BRAKES WERE APPLIEDPRIOR TO SHOVE.  NO SWITCHES WERE INVOLVED.  DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY RAISED SPIKES WHICH ALLOWED THE OUTSIDE RAIL TO ROLL.  AFTER THE RAIL ROLLED, THE WHEELS ON OPPOSITE SIDE BEGAN FALLING INSIDE TOTHE GROUND.

000098130-d-11-29-11-CSX.Primary Accident Cause: Interference (other than vandalism) with railroad operations by nonrailroad employee
000098130-d-11-29-11-CSX.Accident Cause: Interference (other than vandalism) with railroad operations by nonrailroad employee
000098130-d-11-29-11-CSX.Narrative: Y331-28 WAS PULLING AN EMPTY COAL TRAIN FROM SOLVAY HILL.  THE CREW HAD PULLED 30 CARS OUT SOLVAY 6AND DOUBLED TO FLINT 6 WHICH HAD 27 CARS IN THE TRACK.  WHEN THE CREW COUPLED TO FLINT 6 THE 23RD CAR FROM THE HEAD END DERAILED DUE TO THE CAR BEING OFF CENTER AND OUT OF THE BOWL.  THE CREW WAS 7 CAR LENGTHS WEST OF THE DERAILED CAR AND DID NOT REALIZE THE CAR DERAILED.  AFTER COUPLING TO FLINT 6THEY CREW PULLED WEST TO DOUBLE TO FLINT 5 AND THE DERAILED CAR RAN THRU A SWITCH AND DAMAGED THE TRACK BED IN THE PROCESS. THIS CAUSED 6 OTHER CARS TO DERAIL BEHIND IT, BUT RE-RE-RAILED WHEN THEY TRAVERSED OVER THE NEXT FROG.  WHEN THE CREW CLEARED FLINT 6 THE MOVE WAS TO DOUBLE TO FLINT 5, ONCE THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR FLINT 5 THE CREW SHOVED BACK 3 CARS AND LOST THE AIR ON THE TRAIN PRIOR TO COUPLING TO FLINT 5.  WHILE MAKING THE REVERSE MOVE THRU THE RUN THRU SWITCH, THIS CAUSED THE GENERALPILE UP AND DERAILED 12 ADDITIONAL CARS.  THE CONDUCTOR WALKED THE TRAIN AND SAW THE CARS DERAILED AND CALLED FOR ASSISTANCE.

000098110-d-11-29-11-CSX.Narrative: Y10129 PULLED UP LEAD TOWARDS FREMONT INDUSTRIAL AND COMPLETED A CLASS 3 BRAKE TEST AND GETS READY TO DEPART. AT THIS POINT THE TRAIN IS ON A 0.8% GRADE LEADING UP TO THE HELL GATE BRIDGE. AFTER THE BRAKE TEST THE TRAIN BEGINS TO DEPART FOR THE ISLAND, TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY A QUARTER MILE AND STALLS. THE ENGINEER REPORTS STALLED ON GRADE ON FREMONT INDUSTRIAL TRACK AND DECISION WAS MADE TO SHOVETRAIN BACK INTO 6 IN ONE YARD TO MAKE A SECOND ATTEMPT TO LEAVE OAK POINT TRAIN WHEN IT EXPERIENCEDAN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY DURING THE REVERSE SHOVING MOVE OFF THE FREMONT INDUSTRIAL. WHILE SHOVING WITH 28 POWERED AXLES ONLINE THE ENGINEER MADE A TEN POUND BRAKE PIPE REDUCTION. HE WAS OPERATING IN THE SIX NOTCH, LOADING APPROXIMATELY 1100 AMPS. THIS RESULTED IN EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCES DERAILING 5 EMPTY CARS, LOCATED 24 THRU 27 AND 30 CARS DEEP IN TRAIN.

GRADE INTO MADISON WHEN ENGINEER REPORTEDHE WAS JUST GETTING READY TO SET TRAIN AIR AGAIN & BEFORE THAT WAS DONE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. ENGINEER REPORTED NOT FEELING ANY SLACK ACTION UNTIL AFTER THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. CONDUCTOR INSPECTED TRAIN AND FOUND 7 CARS DERAILED (CARS #37 THRU 43 FROM THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN). 4 OF 7 CARS DERAILED WERE RESIDUE HAZMAT'L CARS WITH NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS RELEASED. PROBABLE CAUSE WAS COMPANY TRACK DUE TO EXTENSIVE TIE WORK RECENTLY COMPLETED IN THE AREA. RAIL IN THE CURVE IS EXTREMELYWORN.

CONDUCTOR ADVISED ENGINEER TO STOP & EMERGENCYAPPLICATION WAS MADE TO STOP MOVEMENT. CONDUCTOR DISMOUNTED STOPPED LOCOMOTIVES TO GET AWAY FROM THEIMPENDING COLLISION. WHILE 636'S CONSIST WAS COMING TO A STOP, CONDUCTOR AAPEMPTED ATTEMPTED TO WAVE DOWN VALERO EMPLOYEE WHO WAS RUNNING THE ENGINE, BUT HE DID NOT SEE THE CONDUCTOR TRYING TO WARN HIM. VELERO EMPLOYEE NOTICED THE STOPPED ENGINES ABOUT TWO SECONDS PRIOR TO IMPACT AND PUT HIS TRAININTO EMERGENCY. VALERO CONSIST STRUCK THE CP CONSIST, BYPASSING DRAWBARS AND SHOVING THE CO CONSIST.THE COMBINED ENGINES AND CARS CAME TO A STOP. 726689-d-11-05-11-IC.Narrative: C78891-04 WAS SHOVING LOADED COAL TRAIN NORTH INTO TRACK DG06 TO CLEAR THE WYE SWITCH WHEN THE TRAINWENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE POINT OF THE SHOVE AND BEGAN WALKING SOUTH WHEN THE AIR WOULD NOT COME UP. THE YARDMASTER STARTED DRIVING ALONG THE SIDE OF THE TRAIN NORTH DISCOVERED THE FOLLOWING CARS DERAILED: NCUX 12509, NCUX 12307, NCUX 12499, NCUX 12534 AND BNSF 650211. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO THE RAIL BREAKING UNDER THE LOAD.

000098021-d-11-25-11-CSX.Narrative: F95024 WAS WORKING IN MARSHALLING YARD, MAKING ROOM TO SPOT THE T39320. THE CREW COUPLED UP IN TRACK#5 AND SWUNG IT TO TRACK # 2. AFTER COUPLING IN TRACK # 2 THE CONDUCTOR WALKED TO THE SOUTH END OFTHE CUT TO CLOSE THE ANGLE COCK ON UTLX 12762. HE THEN CALLED THE PTI VAN TO PICK HIM UP AND TAKE HIM TO THE SOUTH END OF TRACK # 2. ONCE HE REACHED THE SOUTH END HE STARTED TO GIVE INSTRUCTIONS TO THE CSXT 7357. HIS RADIO WAS IN CONFLICT WITH THE RADIO IN THE VAN, AND BEGAN TO MAKE A SQUELCHING NOISE. CONDUCTOR THEN TURNED OFF HIS HAND HELD RADIO AND BEGAN USING THE RADIO THAT IS INSTALLED IN THEPTI VAN. CONDUCTOR INSTRUCTED CSXT 7357 TO BEGIN THE SHOVE MOVE AND THAT THEY WERE CLEAR FOR 40 CARS. CONDUCTOR COULD NOT SEE THE CARS COMING AROUND THE CURVE AND INSTRUCTED THE CSXT 7357 TO CONTINUEON, AT LEAST 25 MORE. HE THEN EXITED THE PTI VAN AND BEGAN TO WALK TO THE CLEARANCE POINT OF TRACK# 2, NEVER TURNING HIS HAND HELD RADIO ON. HE CONTINUED TO COUNT THE LOCOMOTIVE DOWN TO A STOP, BUTCOULD NOT BE HEARD NOT REALIZING THAT THE RADIO WAS OFF. THIS LEAD TO UTLX 12767 SIDE SWIPING CSXT 829510 AND CSXT 822437 WHICH WERE THE 73RD AND 74TH CARS IN THE T39320 SITTING ON THE EASTOVER SIDING.

000097799-d-11-18-11-CSX.Narrative: Y21018 CREW PLACED 5 HOPPER CARS ONTO TRACK 5 AT CARGILL. TRACK 5 ALREADY HAD 2 CARS THAT CONDUCTORKNEW ABOUT. THERE WERE 5 TANK CARS IN TRACK THAT CONDUCTOR DID NOT KNOW ABOUT. AS THE Y21018 CONDUCTOR SHOVED THE 5 HOPPERS TO TRACK 5, THE CONDUCTOR TIED ONTO THE 2 CARS HE WAS AWARE OF, AND THEN BEGAN SHOVING INTO THE CLEAR ON THE NORTH END. CONDUCTOR FAILED TO PROTECT SHOVE AROUND CURVE INTO TRACK 5 AND WITHOUT KNOWING, HIT THE 5 CARS ON THE SOUTH END OF TRACK SHOVING THEM APPROX. 100 FT PAST CLEARANCE POINT. AT THIS POINT TRACK 5 NOW HAS 12 TOTAL CARS AND IS FOULING THE ADJACENT TRACK (CARGILL MAIN) AT THE SOUTH END. CONDUCTOR ASSUMES THAT THE TRACK ONLY HAS 7 CARS IN IT. Y21018 THEN CUTSAWAY FROM CARS IN TRACK 5, EXITS THE TRACK, AND PROCEEDS SOUTH DOWN THE CARGILL MAIN TRACK TO RUN AROUND THE CARS IN TRACK 5. CREW IS NOW A 3 ENGINE CONSIST. AS CONDUCTOR DIRECTS ENGINE LITE SHOVE MOVE DOWN THE CARGILL MAIN, HE FAILS TO SEE THAT TRACK 5 ADJACENT IS FOULING THE CARGILL MAIN HE FAILSTO STOP MOVEMENT IN TIME RESULTING IN SIDESWIPE COLLISION.

SW1101D-d-11-18-11-SW.Narrative: CREW ON LSWC002118I MADE DECISION TO STOP AT WEST END OF SIDING AT CAMPBELL. TO BLOCK CARS IN TRAINFOR CUSTOMERS DOWNLINE. TO BEGIN SWITCHING, CARS WERE LEFT ON BOTH THE SIDING AND THE MAINLINE. CARSLEFT ON SIDING WERE NOT SUFFICIENTLY SECURED AND ROLLED EASTWARD DOWN THE SIDING, STRIKING THE DERAIL AND DERAILING 3 OF THE 4 CARS. THIS WAS UNKNOWN TO THE TRAIN CREW DUE TO THE DARKNESS.  CARS LEFTON THE MAINLINE WERE NOT SUFFICIENTLY SECURED, AND THEY TOO ROLLED EASTWARD DOWN THE MAINLINE, STRIKING THE CARS DERAILED FROM THE SIDING. AGAIN UNKNOWN TO THE TRAIN CREW. AS THEY CONTINUED TO SWITCHCARS ONTO THE SIDING AND THE MAINLINE WITH NO BUMPERS TO GO AGAINST, EACH CUT OF CARS SWITCHED OUTROLLED THE LENGTH OF SIDING, IMPACTING THE CARS ALREADY DERAILED ON THE EAST END. CREW WAS NOT AWAREOF ANYTHING GOING WRONG UNTIL THEY WENT TO GATHER UP THE CARS FROM EACH TRACK TO DOUBLE THEM BACK TOGETHER. CREW WAS TESTED = NO POSITIVES. CAUSE H020 WAS FOUND DUE TO INSUFFICIENT HANDBRAKES BEING APPLIED. CONTRIBUTING CAUSE FOUND DUE TO INADEQUATE PRECAUTIONS BEING TAKEN DURING THE SWITCHING.

D524911-d-11-04-11-SKOL.Narrative: THE SKOL 206 JOB PULLED AROUND THE NEW CONNECTION TO SHOVE EAST AND PICK UP 21 CARS AT CARSON STREET.  CONDUCTOR #2 LINED THE NORTH LEG SWITCH FOR  MOVEMENT AND STATES THAT THE SOUTH LEG SWITCH IS ALREADY LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT.  CONDUCTOR #1 IS RIDING THE SHOVE (ON THE SOUTHSIDE OF THE TANK CAR)AND STATES THAT THE SOUTH LEG WYE WAS LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT.  AFTER REVIEW, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE SOUTH LEG WYE SWITCH WAS NOT LINED BACK PROPERLY AFTER THIS SAME CREW PARKED THE SKOL 3834 INTHE SOUTH LEG WYE.  ALL CREW MEMBERS CONFIRM THAT THEY DID NOT LINE THE SWITCH BACK FOR THE INTENDEDMOVEMENT AFTER PARKING THE SKOL 3834 IN THE WYE.  THIS WOULD HAVE CAUSED THE CREW TO RUN THRU THE SOUTH LEG WYE SWITCH ON THE EASTBOUND MOVEMENT.

000098112-d-11-29-11-CSX.Narrative: Y29229 ENTERED THE SOUTH END OF TRACK A16 WITH CARS. AFTER SHOVING THE CARS INTO A16, THE RCO FOREMAN PLACED 6 CARS IN THE TRACK AND CUT AWAY TO CONTINUE SWITCHING. AT APPROXIMATELY 1905, THE 6 CARS IN A16 ROLLED NORTH INTO THE Y29029 ZONE. WHILE HOLDING ONTO A CUT OF 17 CARS IN THE NE SWITCHING LEAD, THE Y29029 REALIZED THAT THE 6 CARS IN A16 WERE GOING TO SIDE-SWIPE HIS CUT. IN AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID THE COLLISION, THE Y29029 SET HIS ENGINE TO PULL HIS 17 CARS NORTH. PRIOR TO HIS ENGINE ACHIEVINGA NORTHWARD MOTION, THE CUTS STRUCK EACH OTHER DERAILING ALL FOUR WHEELS OF THE Y29029 CAR CSXT 158803, AND THE RRRX 407. THE INVESTIGATION TEAM DETERMINED THAT THE Y29229 FOREMAN FAILED TO PROPERLYSECURE THE 6-CAR CUT IN A16.

110611-d-11-06-11-SFRV.Narrative: OPERATOR OF HIGHWAY VEHICLE TURNED SOUTH ONTO ML2, MISTAKING THE TRACKS AS THE I-95 ON RAMP, AND BECAME STUCK. OPERATOR AND TWO OCCUPANTS EXITED THE VEHICLE. THE NORTHBOUND TRAIN STRUCK THE VEHICLE WHICH BECAME ENGULFED IN FLAMES. THE TRAIN WAS EVACUATED AND SOME PASSENGERS SUSTAINED INJURIES DURINGEVACUATION. INJURED PASSENGERS WERE TRANSPORTED TO MEDICAL FACILITIES FOR TREATMENT OF NON LIFE-THREATENING INJURIES.

000115841-d-11-13-11-CSX.Primary Accident Cause: Other locomotive defects (Provide detail description in narrative)
000115841-d-11-13-11-CSX.Accident Cause: Other locomotive defects (Provide detail description in narrative)
000115841-d-11-13-11-CSX.Narrative: LOCOMOTIVE 810 WAS SHOPPED FOR INSPECTION FOR REPORTED EXCESSIVE LATERAL MOVEMENT. THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS OUT OF SERVICE AND NOT IN OPERATION. AN EMPLOYEE REPORTED HEARING AN EXPLOSION. FURTHER INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT AN EXPLOSION HAD NOT OCCURRED BUT RATHER THE EMPLOYEE HEARD THE SOUND OF A ROD PIERCING THE BLOCK OF THE HEP UNIT. THIS MECHANICAL FAILURE RESULTED IN HOT OIL COMING INTO CONTACT WITH HOT EXHAUST EQUIPMENT, SUBSEQUENTLY RESULTING IN A FIRE. THE HEP WAS THE ONLY COMPONENT DESTROYED.SFRV EQUIPMENT DAMAGE IS $26,274.00.
